00031 class TriggerList;

00033 class TriggerMem
00034 {
00035   vector<TriggerList*> trigger_lists;
00036   char* triggerlist_data;
00037   StateObj* stateObj;
00038 
00039 public:
00040   void addTriggerList(TriggerList* t)
00041   { trigger_lists.push_back(t); }
00042 
00043   void finaliseTriggerLists();
00044 
00045   TriggerMem(StateObj* _stateObj) : triggerlist_data(NULL), stateObj(_stateObj)
00046   {}
00047 
00048   void allocateTriggerListData(unsigned mem)
00049   {
00050     D_ASSERT(triggerlist_data == NULL);
00051     triggerlist_data = new char[mem];
00052   }
00053 
00054   char* getTriggerListDataPtr() { return triggerlist_data; }
00055   ~TriggerMem()
00056   { delete[] triggerlist_data; }
00057 };
00058 
00059 class TriggerList
00060 {
00061   StateObj* stateObj;
00062 
00063   TriggerList(const TriggerList&);
00064   void operator=(const TriggerList&);
00065   bool only_bounds;
00066 
00067 public:
00068   TriggerList(StateObj* _stateObj, bool _only_bounds) : stateObj(_stateObj),
00069   only_bounds(_only_bounds)
00070   {
00071     var_count_m = 0;
00072     lock_first = lock_second = 0;
00073   }
00074 
00075   vector<vector<vector<Trigger> > > triggers;
00076 
00077 #ifdef DYNAMICTRIGGERS
00078 #ifdef WATCHEDLITERALS
00079   MemOffset dynamic_triggers;
00080 #else
00081   BackTrackOffset dynamic_triggers;
00082 #endif
00083 #endif
00084 
00085   Trigger** trigger_data_m;
00086 
00087   int var_count_m;
00088   int lock_first;
00089   int lock_second;
00090 
00091   DomainInt vars_min_domain_val;
00092   DomainInt vars_max_domain_val;
00093   unsigned vars_domain_size;
00094 
00095   void lock(int size, DomainInt min_domain_val, DomainInt max_domain_val)
00096   {
00097     D_ASSERT(!lock_first && !lock_second);
00098     lock_first = true;
00099     var_count_m = size;
00100     vars_min_domain_val = min_domain_val;
00101     vars_max_domain_val = max_domain_val;
00102     vars_domain_size = checked_cast<unsigned>(max_domain_val - min_domain_val + 1);
00103 
00104     triggers.resize(4);
00105     for(unsigned i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
00106       triggers[i].resize(var_count_m);
00107 
00108 #ifdef DYNAMICTRIGGERS
00109     if(only_bounds)
00110       dynamic_triggers = getMemory(stateObj).nonBackTrack().request_bytes(size * sizeof(DynamicTrigger) * 4);
00111     else
00112       dynamic_triggers = getMemory(stateObj).nonBackTrack().request_bytes(size * sizeof(DynamicTrigger) * (4 + vars_domain_size));
00113 #else
00114     if(only_bounds)
00115       dynamic_triggers = getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().request_bytes(size * sizeof(DynamicTrigger) * 4);
00116     else
00117       dynamic_triggers = getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().request_bytes(size * sizeof(DynamicTrigger) * (4 + vars_domain_size));
00118 #endif
00119     getTriggerMem(stateObj).addTriggerList(this);
00120   }
00121 
00122   size_t memRequirement()
00123   {
00124     D_ASSERT(lock_first && !lock_second);
00125     size_t storage = 0;
00126     for(unsigned i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
00127     {
00128       for(unsigned j = 0; j < triggers[i].size(); ++j)
00129         storage += triggers[i][j].size();
00130     }
00131     return storage * sizeof(Trigger) + 4 * (var_count_m + 1) * sizeof(Trigger*);
00132   }
00133 
00134   struct CompareMem
00135   {
00136     bool operator()(const Trigger& t1, const Trigger& t2)
00137     { return t1.constraint->getTrigWeight() < t2.constraint->getTrigWeight(); }
00138   };
00139 
00140   void allocateMem(char* mem_start)
00141   {
00142 #ifdef SORT_TRIGGERRANGES
00143     // We can sort triggers if you like here!
00144     for(unsigned type = 0; type < 4; ++type)
00145     {
00146       for(unsigned i = 0; i < triggers[type].size(); ++i)
00147       {
00148         std::sort(triggers[type][i].begin(), triggers[type][i].end(), CompareMem());
00149       }
00150     }
00151 #endif
00152 
00153     D_ASSERT(lock_first && !lock_second);
00154     lock_second = true;
00155     Trigger** trigger_ranges = (Trigger**)(mem_start);
00156     trigger_data_m = trigger_ranges;
00157     Trigger* trigger_data = (Trigger*)(mem_start + 4 * (triggers[UpperBound].size() + 1) * sizeof(Trigger*));
00158 
00159     for(unsigned int type = 0; type < 4; ++type)
00160     {
00161       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < triggers[type].size(); ++i)
00162       {
00163         *trigger_ranges = trigger_data;
00164         ++trigger_ranges;
00165         for(unsigned int j = 0; j < triggers[type][i].size(); ++j)
00166         {
00167           *trigger_data = triggers[type][i][j];
00168           trigger_data++;
00169         }
00170       }
00171       *trigger_ranges = trigger_data;
00172       ++trigger_ranges;
00173     }
00174 
00175     D_ASSERT(static_cast<void*>(mem_start + 4 * (var_count_m + 1) * sizeof(Trigger*)) ==
00176       static_cast<void*>(trigger_ranges));
00177 
00178 
00179   // This is a common C++ trick to completely free the memory of an object.
00180     {
00181       vector<vector<vector<Trigger> > > t;
00182       triggers.swap(t);
00183     }
00184 
00185     DynamicTrigger* trigger_ptr = static_cast<DynamicTrigger*>(dynamic_triggers.get_ptr());
00186 
00187     int trigger_types = ( only_bounds ? 4 : (4 + vars_domain_size));
00188     for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_count_m * trigger_types; ++i)
00189     {
00190       new (trigger_ptr + i) DynamicTrigger;
00191       D_ASSERT((trigger_ptr + i)->sanity_check_list());
00192     }
00193   }
00194 
00195   pair<Trigger*, Trigger*> get_trigger_range(int var_num, TrigType type)
00196   {
00197     Trigger** first_trig = trigger_data_m + var_num + (var_count_m + 1) * type;
00198     Trigger* trig_range_start = *first_trig;
00199     first_trig++;
00200     Trigger* trig_range_end = *first_trig;
00201     return pair<Trigger*,Trigger*>(trig_range_start, trig_range_end);
00202   }
00203 
00204   void dynamic_propagate(int var_num, TrigType type, DomainInt val_removed = NoDomainValue)
00205   {
00206     D_ASSERT(val_removed == NoDomainValue || ( type == DomainRemoval && val_removed != NoDomainValue) );
00207     D_ASSERT(!only_bounds || type != DomainRemoval);
00208     DynamicTrigger* trig;
00209     if(type != DomainRemoval)
00210     {
00211       trig = static_cast<DynamicTrigger*>(dynamic_triggers.get_ptr())
00212         + var_num + type*var_count_m;
00213     }
00214     else
00215     {
00216       D_ASSERT(!only_bounds);
00217       D_ASSERT(vars_min_domain_val <= val_removed);
00218       D_ASSERT(vars_max_domain_val >= val_removed);
00219       trig = static_cast<DynamicTrigger*>(dynamic_triggers.get_ptr())
00220         + checked_cast<int>(var_num + (DomainRemoval + (val_removed - vars_min_domain_val)) * var_count_m);
00221     }
00222     D_ASSERT(trig->next != NULL);
00223     // This is an optimisation, no need to push empty lists.
00224     if(trig->next != trig)
00225       getQueue(stateObj).pushDynamicTriggers(trig);
00226   }
00227 
00228   void push_upper(int var_num, DomainInt upper_delta)
00229   {
00230     if (getState(stateObj).isDynamicTriggersUsed()) dynamic_propagate(var_num, UpperBound);
00231     D_ASSERT(lock_second);
00232     D_ASSERT(upper_delta > 0 || getState(stateObj).isFailed());
00233 
00234     pair<Trigger*, Trigger*> range = get_trigger_range(var_num, UpperBound);
00235     if(range.first != range.second)
00236       getQueue(stateObj).pushTriggers(TriggerRange(range.first, range.second,
00237                                                    checked_cast<int>(upper_delta)));
00238   }
00239 
00240   void push_lower(int var_num, DomainInt lower_delta)
00241   {
00242     if (getState(stateObj).isDynamicTriggersUsed()) dynamic_propagate(var_num, LowerBound);
00243     D_ASSERT(lock_second);
00244     D_ASSERT(lower_delta > 0 || getState(stateObj).isFailed());
00245     pair<Trigger*, Trigger*> range = get_trigger_range(var_num, LowerBound);
00246     if(range.first != range.second)
00247       getQueue(stateObj).pushTriggers(TriggerRange(range.first, range.second,
00248                                                    checked_cast<int>(lower_delta)));
00249   }
00250 
00251 
00252   void push_assign(int var_num, DomainInt)
00253   {
00254     if (getState(stateObj).isDynamicTriggersUsed()) dynamic_propagate(var_num, Assigned);
00255     D_ASSERT(lock_second);
00256     pair<Trigger*, Trigger*> range = get_trigger_range(var_num, Assigned);
00257     if(range.first != range.second)
00258       getQueue(stateObj).pushTriggers(TriggerRange(range.first, range.second, -1));
00259   }
00260 
00261   void push_domain_changed(int var_num)
00262   {
00263     if (getState(stateObj).isDynamicTriggersUsed()) dynamic_propagate(var_num, DomainChanged);
00264 
00265     D_ASSERT(lock_second);
00266     pair<Trigger*, Trigger*> range = get_trigger_range(var_num, DomainChanged);
00267     if (range.first != range.second)
00268       getQueue(stateObj).pushTriggers(TriggerRange(range.first, range.second, -1));
00269   }
00270 
00271   void push_domain_removal(int var_num, DomainInt val_removed)
00272   {
00273     D_ASSERT(!only_bounds);
00274     dynamic_propagate(var_num, DomainRemoval, val_removed);
00275     D_ASSERT(lock_second);
00276   }
00277 
00278   void add_domain_trigger(int b, Trigger t)
00279   {
00280     D_ASSERT(!only_bounds);
00281     D_ASSERT(lock_first && !lock_second);
00282     triggers[DomainChanged][b].push_back(t);
00283   }
00284 
00285   void add_trigger(int b, Trigger t, TrigType type)
00286   {
00287     D_ASSERT(type != DomainRemoval);
00288     D_ASSERT(lock_first && !lock_second);
00289     triggers[type][b].push_back(t);
00290   }
00291 
00292 
00293   void addDynamicTrigger(int b, DynamicTrigger* t, TrigType type, DomainInt val BT_FUNDEF)
00294   {
00295     D_ASSERT(lock_second);
00296     D_ASSERT(!only_bounds || type != DomainRemoval);
00297     D_ASSERT(t->constraint != NULL);
00298     D_ASSERT(t->sanity_check == 1234);
00299   // This variable is only use in debug mode, and will be optimised away at any optimisation level.
00300     DynamicTrigger* old_list;
00301     old_list = t->next;
00302     DynamicTrigger* queue;
00303     if(type != DomainRemoval)
00304     {
00305       queue = static_cast<DynamicTrigger*>(dynamic_triggers.get_ptr())
00306         + b + type*var_count_m;
00307     }
00308     else
00309     {
00310       D_ASSERT(!only_bounds);
00311       D_ASSERT(vars_min_domain_val <= val);
00312       D_ASSERT(vars_max_domain_val >= val);
00313       queue = static_cast<DynamicTrigger*>(dynamic_triggers.get_ptr())
00314         + checked_cast<int>(b + (DomainRemoval + (val - vars_min_domain_val)) * var_count_m);
00315     }
00316     D_ASSERT(queue->sanity_check_list());
00317 
00318 #ifdef BTWLDEF
00319     switch(op)
00320     {
00321         case TO_Default:
00322             D_DATA(t->setQueue((DynamicTrigger*)BAD_POINTER));
00323         break;
00324         case TO_Store:
00325         t->setQueue(queue);
00326         break;
00327         case TO_Backtrack:
00328             D_ASSERT(t->getQueue() != (DynamicTrigger*)BAD_POINTER);
00329             // Add to queue.
00330             t->setQueue(queue);
00331         break;
00332         default:
00333         abort();
00334     }
00335 #endif
00336 
00337     t->add_after(queue, getQueue(stateObj).getNextQueuePtrRef());
00338     D_ASSERT(old_list == NULL || old_list->sanity_check_list(false));
00339   }
00340 
00341 };
00342 
00343 void inline TriggerMem::finaliseTriggerLists()
00344   {
00345     size_t trigger_size = 0;
00346     for(unsigned int i = 0;i < trigger_lists.size(); i++)
00347       trigger_size += trigger_lists[i]->memRequirement();
00348     getTriggerMem(stateObj).allocateTriggerListData(trigger_size);
00349 
00350     char* triggerlist_offset = getTriggerMem(stateObj).getTriggerListDataPtr();
00351 
00352     for(unsigned int i=0;i<trigger_lists.size();i++)
00353     {
00354       size_t offset = trigger_lists[i]->memRequirement();
00355       trigger_lists[i]->allocateMem(triggerlist_offset);
00356       triggerlist_offset += offset;
00357     }
00358     D_ASSERT(triggerlist_offset - getTriggerMem(stateObj).getTriggerListDataPtr() == (int)trigger_size);
00359   }
00360 
00361 inline void releaseTrigger(StateObj* stateObj, DynamicTrigger* trig BT_FUNDEF_NODEFAULT)
00362 {
00364         trig->remove(getQueue(stateObj).getNextQueuePtrRef());
00365 }

00367 #endif //TRIGGERLIST_H
